title: When your teemo top laner goes "gg no tank"

replies.body:
I'm not a teemo player, but you can't just blame your top laner for not playing a tank. 3 roles often can play tanks: Top, Jungle, and Support.  If you're in a ranked game, and the top laner has first pick and they pick a squishy top laner they can totally blame jungle and support if they also pick squishy champs and the team has no tank.  The same is true if support or jungle is first pick, then they can blame the top laner if they don't pick a tank.

I guess my point is there are plenty of meta top laners that aren't tanks, so just because someone didn't pick a tank in the top lane doesn't mean they can't complain about having no frontline.

I think it should be based on pick order, instead of just assuming the top laner isn't a team player because they didn't pick a tank.

I don't think its fair to blame the support. One support doesn't usually make for enough of a front line. Either the jg or top needs to pick a tank or fighter. Probably both if your support is going mage support

Support tanks still get tanky enough and can very easily front line by themselves if they do well or play smartly. As long as Teemo picked before both jungle and support, you can't fault him for a no tank comp. The same is true for both of the other roles when they pick squishy champions in their roles first. The only time you can't fault somebody for complaining about comp when they were in a position that could fix it, is when they are a late pick.

> [{quoted}](name=Monado II,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OYixlovs,comment-id=000b0002,timestamp=2016-11-05T03:42:34.328+0000)
>
> I don't think its fair to blame the support.

http://prettylittleliars.com/files/2016/03/aria-says-its-happening-again-in-pll-619.gif

But on a more serious note, it's totally possible the support is the only tank you NEED while top and jg play carry champs that give a further advantage in teamfights as long as they have at least one player front-lining.

funny thing is I hate when people act like supports are perfect golden children who can do no wrong

but I just don't think a Leona 2-3 levels below everyone else is going to be the only tank/fighter you need realistically. you just cant have teemo top shaco jg it does not work out well. its like having a team with 0 AP threats, maybe worse.

The team comp matter more on champs than the class (there is definitely a correlation though) Like Jayce top with Nid jungle for a poke comp, then some tank support like Braum for necessary peel and possible engage.

It all really just depends on the team itself, you could even go no tanks and win on pure cc and damage without needing anyone to soak some up.
except since ranged tops are so popular and riot doesn't really seem to care, only 2 roles can viably pick tanks
What about Gnar ? Isn't he both?
No, you can't blame your teammates for picking something that they want to play just because you think it fits with the team comp that YOU wanted.

The opposite is true. They can't blame you for not fitting in the comp that they wanted. They isn't collective, as a group. "They" could be individual; The Yasuo mid, the Vayne ADC, the Brand Support, the Master Yi jgl, etc.
you are wrong

Actually it is pretty ignorant behavior. Locking whatever the hell you want without a care for the team comp and then complaining about the team comp. When I pick soraka and zyra into top lane I don't then turn around and complain that there are no tanks. I picked a role generally expected to be covered by someone tankier and put soraka... zyra or teemo in there. It was teemo who tried to force everyone else into a role he wanted and he was wrong to think just because he would pick teemo top that everyone else would pick up the slack and play tanks.

When your jungler goes afk at level 5, your adc goes 0/12/3, and you post to complain about the Teemo.

Sounds about right.
{{champion:17}} GG no tank
{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
Poke comps can be pretty devastating in SoloQ, no brainless front line smashing into the enemy lines 1v5 then crying about "wtf where's my team"

I use it but i'm a teemo main sooooo XD Teemo is mainly good for decimating a front line or killing split pusher's, it's what he's good at.

Support main problems.
Braum top is fun and all but under no circumstance is it "the best possible pick"

"the best possible pick ***for our comp***"

You don't have to win lane as long as you don't feed and snowball the other person (unless they're Susan - then Braum is just boned). With a comp like that, Braum is a weak pick in lane but his wall and peel make him ideal once mid game rolls around.
And I'm saying under no circumstances. I don't care what your composition is there's always a better choice than braum top.

I play him support. I don't play tank supports anyways. 

I play Sona soraka or lulu. 

However tankmo support works best. 

You buy a frozen mallet zzrot and ages for team MR

Sightstone and support items are core. 

Still experimenting. Best route.

Never in ranked. I'm a casual.

I'm used to down votes when I talk in gameplay anyways. 

I gave up on ranked a long time ago and realized I don't care about being the best but having fun.

Sense then I don't rage as much when I do bad or when people take my kills even when I'm adc. It doesn't matter anymore really. 

You wanna try hard? Go to ranked. 

If I catch people raging in normals I make them more salty and push their buttons.. And if they get salty enough.. I report them. 

I'm a horrible person for how many times I get the report feedback. 

I may not be the best but I'm a dann fun person to play with. 

Do weird shot like AP Caitlyn top for all I care.. My friend actually tried.. He succeeded for a short while but then it went downhill. Lol

Again NOT IN RANKED. Lol

Yeah I would just do normals, but most of the people I play with consider unranked games to be a bit of a waste.  Fortunately I can avoid most of the salt by playing in groups of 3+.

Last year actually, over 50% of my games were probably in hide and seek.  I still miss Crystal Scar for that mode.  Even with all the trolls, it was extremely fun.
When your teemo builds tankmo and carries the game
Just play Tankmo the Global Taunt.

God does this piss me off. I play assassin jgs, and I can understand that you might want a tank. Pick a tank yourself then. I play best with my comfort picks, if a tank means that much to you then take matters into your own hands.

Teemo is a pretty crappy pick if we're being honest guys.

His laning phase is deadly for certain champions, but after that? He's pretty much just a pest. If the person laning against Teemo realizes the hell they're going through is only going to last so long, they can easily group for objectives and win the game, especially if that team has no tank.

Teemo is a selfish pick, and I support your right to make bad decisions because nobody should tell anyone who they should pick. I'm a support main and I really hate that. Just realize that you are hurting your team with those picks most of the time, which ultimately ends up hurting yourself. Obviously the person OP was playing with doesn't get that.

That's pretty much because he's left purposely weak due to his toxic kit. Teemo has barely had any changes since the beta days of League - though can't really blame the squishy top laner if they're one of the first picks. Both junger and support roles can also play tanky champs as well.

To be honest, I've played Teemo for years and personally love his hit and run gameplay; however, would love to see a rework for him to give a better teamfighting potential for the little guy.  He's a marksmen that is pretty much forced to go top lane due to his low range and ap scalings which make him a poor choice as an adc. Regardless, won't deny that there are many troll players who pick Teemo; however, don't judge us all as the same folks.

Regardless, won't deny that there are many troll players who pick Teemo; however, don't judge us all as the same folks.

Good point. I wanted to address the whole first pick top laner thing, and this isn't to you specifically but I just started reading some of the replies here.

First pick doesn't give you an excuse to ignore team composition. You don't even need an excuse to do that because it isn't against the rules and sometimes composition doesn't even matter. In close games it does.

**If you're going top lane, always use pick intent.** If you're below the support or jungler in the pick order, how will they know what to pick? I'm a support main, and I'm more than willing to attempt to fill out what we're missing, but you also need to remember two important things about the support role.

We are normally 3-4 levels behind everyone else, no matter how well we do, and our income is by far the smallest and with must-buy support items. We are inferior to laning tanks in terms of sustain, but we do bring the lock down. If jungle and top lane are both picking something like Rengar top and Teemo top, you still need to be extra cautious when team fighting comes around, especially if one or more of you lost lane.

Not only that, but I'm supposed to get my ADC through their laning phase. Bot lane is so deadly early game now, so I'm not going to be picking Leona (the tank I play) into something like Miss Fortune and Zilean if I can help it. If we die, the enemy ADC snowballs quickly.

I also see a lot of people making excuses for playing squishy picks top. Own it. There are many proper tanks that do so well in this meta like Illaoi and Nasus, and then there are fighters that are still great picks like Irelia, Renekton, and Darius. If you're going to play Yasuo, Kennen, and Teemo top then just own it. You aren't doing anything wrong, but don't complain about no tanks.
